did.unittitle: Terminal Report of the President's Steel Fact-Finding Board, 1946
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Terminal Report of the President's Steel Fact-Finding Board, submitted February 25, 1946.

bioghist.p: The President's Steel Fact-Finding Board was appointed in the dispute between the steel producing subsidiaries of the United States Steel Corporation and the United Steelworkers of America, CIO. President Harry S. Truman appointed the board on December 31, 1945.
Roger I. McDonough, James M. Douglas, and Nathan P. Feinsinger (chair) served on the board.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the terminal Report of the President's Steel Fact-Finding Board, submitted February 25, 1946.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. President's Steel Fact-Finding Board

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
